content.raw: Well I chose the `eslint` to run on the `src` files since that would make fixing the errors much more easier, I think we might want to make the `jshint` run on the `src` files too, if that wouldn't cause any problems.
content.html: Well I chose the eslint to run on the src files since that would make fixing the errors much more easier, I think we might want to make the jshint run on the src files too, if that wouldn't cause any problems.

content.raw:
There is some inconsistency on how we're using the linters. 

* `npm run update`  concatenates `src/*.js` into `gz3d.js` from  and then runs JSHint on `gz3d.js`
* `npm test` runs ESLint on `src/*.js` and then runs tests using `gz3d.js`

We can create a separate issue for this, but I think it would be more coherent if:

* both linters were run with the same command
* both linters should run on the same files, either the source files or the built file
content.html:
There is some inconsistency on how we're using the linters.

  • npm run update concatenates src/*.js into gz3d.js from and then runs JSHint on gz3d.js
  • npm test runs ESLint on src/*.js and then runs tests using gz3d.js

We can create a separate issue for this, but I think it would be more coherent if:

  • both linters were run with the same command
  • both linters should run on the same files, either the source files or the built file

content.html: Ah right, Thanks.
